newsitem.title: USA: Durham, N.C., advances $86.3 million GO referendum.
newsitem.headline: Durham, N.C., advances $86.3 million GO referendum.

text.p: The finance committee of the Durham, N.C., City Council has approved a proposed referendum on five general obligation bond issues totalling $86.3 million, the News & Observer said Friday.
If approved by the full council on Sept 3, the proposals would go on the Nov 5 ballot.
The issues include $35.2 million for streets, $20.4 million for parks and recreation, $20 million for housing, $5.2 million for public transportation and $5.5 million for arts and museums.
If all five are approved, the city's tax rate would rise by six cents per $100 of assessed value by 2003.

The finance committee trimmed the proposals, which had originally totalled $95.5 million. The full council could trim them further, but could not increase them without postponing the referendum, the newspaper said.
